function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of empirical research in the impact of pandemics on urban environments and architecture","Impact":"Inability to effectively mitigate the spread of contagious diseases in urban environments","Mitigation":"Conducting comprehensive empirical research to understand the impact and inform design responses","Technologies":"Remote sensing technology, data analytics, and simulation tools","People":"Communities in urban environments, architects, and city planners","Owner":"Researchers, urban planners, and government authorities"},{"Description":"Uncertainty about the social and psychological implications of emerging lifestyles in new spatial environments","Impact":"Potential neglect of mental health and social well-being in urban designs","Mitigation":"Engaging in interdisciplinary research to comprehend the social and psychological implications","Technologies":"Social science research methods, surveys, and behavioral analysis tools","People":"Residents of urban areas, mental health professionals, and urban designers","Owner":"Academic institutions, mental health organizations, and urban design firms"},{"Description":"Acceptability of the new normal and social distancing measures","Impact":"Resistance to adherence to social distancing measures, leading to increased risk of disease spread","Mitigation":"Developing communication strategies and public engagement initiatives to promote acceptance of the new normal","Technologies":"Social media platforms, public health campaigns, and community outreach tools","People":"General public, policymakers, and community leaders","Owner":"Public health organizations, government authorities, and community advocacy groups"}]}
